summary:
### 📌 Disease:
📌  Durian Allocaridara Attack (DCA)

### 💥 Cause:
- 💥  Durian Allocaridara, a small, soft-bodied insect, causes this disease by piercing durian flowers and fruits to feed on sap.


### 😷 Symptoms:
- 😷  Metallic-bright spots on undersides of leaves, collapsed flowers, and rotten spots on fruits.


### 💊 Treatment & Prevention:
- 💊  Use sticky traps to monitor and control insects, tardive applications of pesticides, and prompt removal of infected parts of the plant. Healthy plant growth and regular sanitation can help prevent infestations.
